intro: Sakersia corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered sakersia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sakersia corymbosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
